word: If there are men who will take up the work of laboring for the most degrading, men upon whom God has laid the burden to labor for the masses in a variety of ways, let these converted ones go forth and gather from the world the means required to do this work. Let them not depend on the means which God intends shall sustain the work of His gospel.--Letter 205, 1899, p. 6. (To Dr. J. H. Kellogg, typed December 19, 1899.)
